While it has been promoted as a work of fiction loosely inspired by true events, it bears some striking similarities — and some key differences — with the account offered in another book authored by a former intelligence officer. RK Yadav's book, Mission R&AW, was released as a tell-all memoir in 2014, detailing "the first eye-opening account ... of the achievements and failures of Indian intelligence". Piecing together the records of what unfolded reveals a desperate race to catch a double agent and understand how and why the CIA convinced an Indian citizen to turn on his own government.
edited_claim: The Infiltrator is a riveting nonfiction book that recounts the true story of an Indian intelligence agent's experiences and challenges faced by him. The book delves into their functioning ambiguity, overlapping mandates and other challenges these agencies are facing. It was written by RK Yadav.

claim_target: Kanger Valley National Park is a national park located in the Indian state of Chhattisgarh. query: India: Which type of formations can be found in Kanger Valley National Park, making it significant?
evidence: Kanger Valley National Park is noted for its highly heterogeneous land formations ranging from low flat and gentle areas to steep slopes, plateaus, valleys, and stream courses. The vast undulating terrain of the Kanger Valley National Park harbors diverse habitats which offer an ideal site for diverse kinds of flora and fauna, thus making it a hotspot of biodiversity in Central India. Kanger Valley National Park has been situated 24 km, Southeast of Jagdalpur, the headquarters of Bastar district, on Jagdalpur -Darbha Road. The National Park derives its name from the Kanger River, which flows centrally from the Northwest to the Southeast direction.

claim_target: Borra Caves are essentially a natural cave in India. The cave is located in the Ananthagiri Hills of the Eastern Ghats, near Araku Valley in Andhra Pradesh. It is perched at an elevation of 1,400 m above sea level and came into existence as a result of the flow of Gosthani river on the limestone deposits in the area. This pre-historic cave has been explored and excavated by archaeologists and speleologists, who have discovered important artifacts and evidence of human habitation.
query: India: Who has explored and excavated Borra Caves, leading to discoveries of artifacts and evidence of human habitation?
evidence: These caves were discovered by William King George of the Geological Survey of India. There he found a shivling deep inside the cave, along with his cow. He believed that Lord Shiva had saved his cow.
edited_claim: Borra Caves are essentially a natural cave in India. The cave is located in the Ananthagiri Hills of the Eastern Ghats, near Araku Valley in Andhra Pradesh. It is perched at an elevation of 1,400 m above sea level and came into existence as a result of the flow of Gosthani river on the limestone deposits in the area. This pre-historic cave has been explored and excavated by archaeologists and speleologists, who have discovered important artifacts and evidence of human habitation. The cave was first discovered by William King George of the Geological Survey of India.
